articles.author: Sunkanmi Fafowora

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Milan Balaƒá)
articles.description: After covering in detail the underlying interaction paradigms of TV experiences in [Part 1](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2025/08/designing-tv-evergreen-pattern-shapes-tv-experiences/), it‚Äôs time to get practical. In the second part of the series, you‚Äôll explore the building blocks of the ‚Äú10-foot experience‚Äù and how to best utilise them in your designs.
articles.title: Designing For TV: Principles, Patterns And Practical Guidance (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Could there be a better way to welcome the new month than with a new collection of desktop wallpapers? We‚Äôve got some eye-catching designs to make your September just a bit more colorful. Enjoy!
articles.title: A Breeze Of Inspiration In September (2025 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lyndon Cerejo)
articles.description: Prompting is more than giving AI some instructions. You could think of it as a design act, part creative brief and part conversation design. This second article on AI augmenting design work introduces a designerly approach to prompting: one that blends creative briefing, interaction design, and structural clarity.
articles.title: Prompting Is A Design Act: How To Brief, Guide And Iterate With AI

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Milan Balaƒá)
articles.description: TV interface design is a unique, fascinating, and often overlooked field. It‚Äôs been guided by decades of evolution and innovation, yet still firmly constrained by its legacy. Follow Milan into the history, quirks, and unshakable rules that dictate how we control these devices.
articles.title: Designing For TV: The Evergreen Pattern That Shapes TV Experiences

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Declan Chidlow)
articles.description: Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) are a great way to make apps built for the web feel native, but in moving away from a browser environment, we can introduce usability issues. This article covers how we can modify our app depending on what display mode is applied to mitigate these issues.
articles.title: Optimizing PWAs For Different Display Modes

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lyndon Cerejo)
articles.description: If you are new to using AI in design or curious about integrating AI into your UX process without losing your human touch, this article offers a grounded, day-by-day look at introducing AI into your design workflow.
articles.title: A Week In The Life Of An AI-Augmented Designer

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alex Williams)
articles.description: AI has introduced huge efficiencies for web designers and is frequently being touted as the key to unlocking sustainable design and development. But do these gains outweigh the environmental cost of using energy-hungry AI tools? This article is an examination of that question, breaking down the sustainability pros and cons of AI use, so you can make informed decisions about the tools you use.
articles.title: The Double-Edged Sustainability Sword Of AI In Web Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nikita Samutin)
articles.description: AI tools are improving fast, but it‚Äôs still not clear how they fit into a real product design workflow. Nikita Samutin walks through four core stages ‚Äî from analytics and ideation to prototyping and visual design ‚Äî to show where AI fits and where it doesn‚Äôt, illustrated with real-world examples.
articles.title: Beyond The Hype: What AI Can Really Do For Product Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Rodolpho Henrique)
articles.description: Rodolpho Henrique guides you through the essential aspects of color in digital design and user experience, from the practical steps of creating effective and scalable color palettes to the critical accessibility considerations. You will explore the psychological impact of different hues and learn how to strategically leverage color to evoke specific emotions, enhance user experience, and understand why thoughtful color choices are essential for successful digital products.
articles.title: The Psychology Of Color In UX Design And Digital Products

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stephanie Campbell)
articles.description: Your past shapes who you are as a designer, no matter where your career began or how unexpected your career path may have been. Stephanie Campbell shows how those lessons can sharpen your instincts, strengthen collaboration, and help you become a better designer today. Learn how the skills you have learned in your previous jobs can be put to work today in meetings, design reviews, and complicated mid-project pivots.
articles.title: From Line To Layout: How Past Experiences Shape Your Design Career

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ilia Kanazin & Marina Chernyshova)
articles.description: Prompting isn‚Äôt just about writing better instructions, but about designing better thinking. Ilia Kanazin and Marina Chernyshova explore how advanced prompting can empower different product & design use cases, speeding up your workflow and improving results, from research and brainstorming to testing and beyond. Let‚Äôs dive in.
articles.title: Designing With AI, Not Around It: Practical Advanced Techniques For Product Design Use Cases
